reviews.review_msg: Very good lectures. The essay grading was very nitpicky, but despite that I did alright. Exams were fair and based exactly on what he said they would be on.

He is the best professor for Psyc 260 course, such good and easy presentation of the material. His study guides make exams so easy and I actually learned a lot in his class as it would focus only on important material. Amazing professor.

One of the best profs I've had at SFU by far, you can tell he wants everyone to succeed and makes the course content super easy to digest and so interesting! Definitely one of those profs you look up by name and enroll in their course just because they're the one teaching it. Highly recommend.

He is honestly such a bright soul, you can tell how passionate he is about social psychology, which makes you so much more engaged. He is clear on what he expects and cares about his student. Also has a very cute dog named Asher iykyk. if you have the chance to take a class with him do it.

The best professor I have ever had!! Lectures are super interesting and engaging. He clearly cares about the students doing well. Lecture videos are posted after class and he holds extra office hours. Grading and exams are fair and it's clear what will be on them. I would definitely recommend taking a class with Jason.

Jason is one of the best professors I've ever experienced at SFU. He is kind and truly cares about each individual student succeeding in his classes. Highly recommend taking a class with him, it's an easy A.

taking this class with jason was the best decision i made. this class is content-heavy (as is every other psyc class), but he makes it so easy to comprehend and provides useful study guides for the midterm and final. he is open to student feedback and ACTUALLY listens, and he is overall a kind and caring prof who wants you to succeed.

One of the best profs I have ever had, he truly cares about his students success and is willing to help out wherever needed. I will be the first in line if he ever teaches another course at SFU :) 100% you will not regret taking a course taught by Jason :)

If you're contemplating between another psyc class and this one, definitely go with psyc 260! Jason's lectures are well-structured and easy to follow. He makes all materials and resources accessible on canvas and often brought snacks to lecture for his students. Overall he is an amazing professor and genuinely cares about his students!

this prof was amazing! course content is straightforward, exam prep can be done using mostly lecture slides, assignments are marked fairly, and assignments/exams are done in a way that promotes learning growth. i would 100% recommend to take a class with this professor he made taking PSYC260 enjoyable.

when I say this man is for the students I mean it. He was so sweet & super transparent about what midterm & final would look like (for the midterm he provided the units the SA questions would be from which was super helpful), midterm & final he gave the choice to stay & redo the MC with a group for a chance to boost ur own grade:)

jason is by far the best prof i have met. the amount of care he has for his students is amazing, and rare. truly wants all his students to succeed, and is so easy to approach. really just a kind human being. would 100% take any class he teaches.

Jason is an amazing prof, he genuinely cares deeply for his students. lectures are interesting and exam material is straight forward. I will definitely take another class with him if I could. also love how he includes his puppy in lectures. 10/10
He is THE MOST CARING prof I've come across, HE EXTREMELY CARES about every student. I cannot wait to see him teaching more classes. He is just such an amazing soul!

Jason is the best prof I have had at SFU. He is always available to help. His lectures are very interesting and engaging. He also provides clear rubrics and feedback. You can just tell Jason is a good person. If you have the chance, definitely take his class!!!!
By far the best Prof in the entire Psych department!

In my 3 years of university, Jason has been the most impactful prof I've ever had. He truly cares about his students and you can tell he is passionate about what he teaches. He really changed the game for my expectations as a prof, he went above and beyond from the good of his heart and he deserves the world. Bonus points he has the cutest dog !!

He is not only overall nice and understanding but you can tell he puts in effort to make the class interesting. The class is easy to follow in my opinion and he is very organized. I also found it easy to contact him outside of class time to ask questions. The papers are easy if you study well which is quite fair. Overall good class

Jason was one of the best professors I've had and as a first time instructor he did a great job. His lectures and lecture materials were straightforward and easy to understand. His exams were fairly easy as well and he cares about his students overall well being a lot. My favourite part of his class was pictures of his cute puppy Asher!
great prof didn't score well due to my own mistake but he taught so well, and the lectures were engaging. even when recorded

Despite only being a lecturer for the first time, Jason did such an amazing job with this class. It was definitely the most engaging and most interesting class I've had so far in my undergrad degree. The lecture content is straightforward and the exams were fair. I would love to see him teach other PSYC courses as well!

Amazing prof! He really seemed to care about improvement and truly understanding the material. Just make sure to pay attention to his lectures. Overall would definitely take again if I can! (Also his dog photos of Ascher were cute).

Jason is simply just awesome. I only wish he taught more classes, He did great for his first time teaching. All lectures were enjoyable and engaging. More importantly, he clearly cares about his students. Every week he would go over improvements suggested by his student. There was an instance where he gave us a mental health break week. Truly great

His class was amazing. If I ever get the chance to have him as my professor again, I'd be so thankful and happy. He cares and is genuine. His class is based on growth, meaning second chances for a quiz and assignment. His exams were fair and actually tested us on the knowledge that mattered. best psyc grade I've gotten. study his lectures. txt no $
Definitely take this class. The class is of average difficulty but the content and Jason are awesome! His dog Asher is adorable.

Jason is such a good prof!!! It was his first semester teaching, and was my favorite prof I've had so far. He is clearly passionate about the subject matter and cares for his students and genuinely wants them to do well. Lectures are very clear, with interactive parts mixed in. Bonus: he has an adorable dog that he provides many pictures of.

Jason was a pleasure to have as a professor. He is a gem. For being his first time teaching, he truly knows how to engage with students. Whenever he is given feedback, he ensures to incorporate it into the course. If all professors were like Jason, so much more students would enjoy university and actually learn course material.

Good stuff. His classes are fun and he includes a lot of videos and makes it very interactive! He always wants what's best for students and really welcomes feedback.

The only problem is his work often takes more time than allotted. He keeps uploading videos and sending multiple announcements and it's tiring trying to keep up with extra time.
One of the best professors Ive ever had. Genuinely cares for students and wants the students to succeed. Fairly easy course load and overall great guy. Highly recommend

TAKE A CLASS WITH HIM IF YOU CAN! Jason was by far one of the best professors I've had! You can tell he genuinely cares for his students and is passionate about what he is teaching. The exams were fair, and there were only two major assignments. Overall, this class was really enjoyable, and I will definitely miss this class.

Jason was the best professor I have had so far in university. Engaging and interesting lectures, and exams that were quite fair. He truly cares to see his students succeed and made sure to check in once a week with everyone to make sure we were following along well in the course. Will miss this class for sure!

Loved taking his class, super supportive with student's learning encouraging. An absolute joy taking his class. Overall structure of classes were organized, easy to understand, workload wasn't heavy. Exams were fair so long as you studied and paid attention to lectures. Did two articles review analysis, second one was optional to improve mark.
